result.markdown: --- title: Jihong Zhang subtitle: "learn() ➮ play()" comments: false toc: false sidebar: false image: "images/profile-3.jpg" title-block-banner: false about: id: hero-heading template: trestles image-shape: round image-width: 15em links: - icon: bi-person-lines-fill text: C.V. href: uploads/Curriculum_Vitae.pdf - icon: envelope text: Email href: mailto:jzhang@uark.edu - icon: twitter text: Twitter href: https://twitter.com/jihongzgamma - icon: github text: Github href: https://github.com/JihongZ - icon: bi-bookmark-heart-fill text: ORCID href: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2820-3734 format: html: code-fold: false code-tools: false --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {#hero-heading .nice-paragraph} [About Me]{.mt2 .mb0 .baskerville .i .fw6 .f4} I currently hold the position of tenure-track Assistant Professor of Educational Statistics and Research Methods ([ESRM](https://esrm.uark.edu/directory/uid/jzhang/name/Jihong+Zhang/)) at the department of Counseling, Leadership, and Research Methods (CLRM), University of Arkansas, Fayetteville, U.S.A. Previously, I served as a postdoctoral fellow at the Chinese University of Hong Kong ([CUHK](https://www.cuhk.edu.hk)) in the department of Social Work. My academic journey in psychometrics starts with a doctoral training with [Dr. Jonathan Templin](https://jonathantemplin.com/) in the Educational Measurement and Statistics (EMS) program at the University of Iowa. My primary research focuses on empirical and methodological studies on psychological/psychometric network modeling, Bayesian latent variable modeling, Item Response Theory modeling, and other advanced psychometric modeling. My expertise lies in the application of advanced statistical modeling in the fields of psychology and education. [![](images/dog.png){width="20"} LEARN MORE ABOUT ME →](about.qmd) :::
